content: windbreak #knitsharelearn when the icy winter winds whip around you and snuggling your hands into your pockets just isn t possible you need a cosy pair of mitts to keep you toasty these very practical mitts are dense and warm leaving the fingers free to get those important jobs done whether you re on the farm tending to the sheep or waiting at the bus stop scrolling through your music collection adding some tunes to the daily commute these mitts will do the trick the windbreak mitts are available in 3 sizes and knit up in a flash making them perfect last minute gifts or quick winter knits #knitsharelearn this free pattern is part of a series by clare devine from knit share love - featuring gorgeous quick knits perfect for learning new skills and fully supported by a range of free tutorials tutorials for this pattern include long tail cast-on icelandic bind-off and tip for creating neat ribbing the henry this special yarn is a collaboration between tarndie a farm in victoria specialising in polwarth and great ocean road woollen mill a small victorian mill creating beautiful bespoke yarns this yarn has been grown and processed within a 75km radius - making it very local information about the producers can be found at www tarndie com designed by clare devine materials pattern notes tarndie and great ocean road woollen mill - the mitts start with a long tail cast-on the cuff and southern ocean chunky 50% polwarth 50% mitt is worked in 2x1 rib shaping for the gusset and alpaca 87m / 95yd per 100g skein the thumb are worked in reverse stocking stitch shade the henry x 1 1 1 yardage used 61 70 79 g / 54 62 71 m / 59 68 the hand and thumb are finished with an icelandic 77 yd bind-off 6mm / us 10 needles suitable for working a small tutorials for the long tail cast-on icelandic bind-off circumference in the round and tips for creating neat ribbing can be found on tapestry needle www knitsharelove com/tutorials waste yarn a smooth cotton of a similar weight is recommended or stitch holder for thumb stitches abbreviations gauge est patt established pattern always use the needle size that enables you to increase increase d match the specified gauge k knit mx marker letter denotes marker 17 sts and 20 rnds over 10cm / 4in of 2x1 rib m1p make one purl lift bar from the front measured relaxed in the round and blocked using of knitting and purl through the back 6mm / us 10 needles of the stitch p purl size s pmx place marker letter denotes marker round round s m l st s stitch es to fit palm circumference measured at widest smx slip marker letter denotes marker point 18 19 5 21 5 cm / 7 7 75 8 5 in finished circumference unstretched 12 5 14 16 cm / 5 5 5 6 25 in length 16 17 18
